doctor_note: The patient reports severe, stabbing pain in the lower back, radiating to the right hip, leg, and foot. Pain intensity is rated at 9/10, and the patient is now experiencing constant numbness in the leg, with episodes of weakness causing near falls. He describes difficulty with daily activities, including walking and sitting for extended periods. Previous medications have provided little to no relief, and the patient reports worsening sleep due to pain. MRI results show a significant disc herniation at L4-L5. Referred for surgical consultation and prescribed gabapentin to manage nerve pain.

diagnosis.reasoning: Report of severe lower back pain radiating to the right hip, leg and foot, constant numbness in the leg, and episodes of weakness. MRI results confirm significant disc herniation at L4-L5.
